alert.note: Alert for Baltimore City; Harford (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 13 at 1:35AM EDT until September 13 at 2:30AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern Maryland, including the following counties, Baltimore, Baltimore City and Harford. * WHEN...Until 245 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 135 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that 2 to 4 inches of rain has fallen earlier across the warned area. The heaviest rain has ended, but excess runoff will continue to cause flooding in some areas - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Baltimore... Middle River... Dundalk... Towson... Bel Air South... Essex... Parkville... Bel Air North... Carney... Perry Hall... Rosedale... Rossville... Timonium... White Marsh... Fallston... Bowleys Quarters... Hampton... Kingsville... Pleasant Hills... Lutherville-Timonium... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
